result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamal Dajon Johnson

Received and Filed: Proposed Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated February 20, 2023

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Jamal Dajon Johnson.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Jamal Dajon Johnson.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  No objection from the State.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Cullen in court for Jamal Dajon Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings.  Defense requests status date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.
Signed and filed: Order for Competency

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court, in custody.  Attorney Angel Johnson in court for Jamal Dajon Johnson on behalf of Attorney Colleen Cullen.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Defendant has another pending matter (22CF3376) in which competency was raised.  Defense raises competency on this matter.  Court vacates jury trial date of September 6, 2022 and schedules a Doctor's Report Return hearing.  Order for Competency by Department of Health Services signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Proposed Order for Competency
Pretrial Services Discharge Report

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom. Case in court at State's request. Revised No Contact Order with Geographic Restrictions / Other Conditions, signed by the Court. Court advises defendant of the revised Order. Case remains calendared for final pretrial 08-31-2022 at 8:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jamal Dajon Johnson
Current: 931 West Wauwatosa St, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 06-14-2022)
Prior: 5203 West Keefe Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53216
signed, REVISED No Contact Order with Geographic Restrictions / Other Conditions
Pretrial Services Violation Report
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify No Contact Order, filed

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial.  The State requesting an adjournment for reasons stated on the record.  The Court VACATES the JURY TRIAL ON  6/6/22 and grant the State's request.  This case was set for a Jury trial along with case 21CF3335 was scheduled for a Speedy Trial. For reasons stated on the record the defendant will be released on a Signature bond.  The court reminds the defendant of bail conditions.   The court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 2.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Colleen Cullen in court, defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case recalled at State's request. Statements by State that the jury trial date was not entered into CCAP on joined case and that the subpoena was not generated. Discussions as to how to proceed. Court orders case remain on for jury trial. First call 9:00 am on 06-06-2022.
Jury Instructions - filed by the State - received

Attorney Robert Hampton for Colleen Cullen in court, defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Court conducts final pretrial off the record. Statements by parties that case remains of trial posture. Court orders case adjourned for jury trial 06-06-2022 at 9:00 am.
State's Witness List - received
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT (10 pages) commencing 02-25-2022 by  DENISE PAHMAN.

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. State's motion for joinder argued. Court grants State's motion in part, joining the felony cases for trial and denying motion to joing the misdemeanor cases for trial. Case adjourned for final pretrial, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:03 pm.
Court reporter for Preliminary Hearing entered incorrectly.  Changed to Karen Palis to Denise Pahman.
`Defense Supplemental Argument in Opposition to the State's Joinder Motion

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Speedy trial demand filed. Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Motion for Joinder, filed

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamal Dajon Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Lawson Murrell, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Cullen has jury duty; is unable to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Yeshiva Elementary School, Avrohom E.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Jamal Dajon Johnson in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
